activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:32 PM Defendant Sean M Freerksen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Sean M Freerksen.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Witness appeared by video.
2:32 Attorney Rockow and Defendant put in a break out room.  2:35 Attorney Rockow relates.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

BOND COVERS 22CF6 & 20CF363.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

08/18/2022 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT POST AN ADDITIONAL $1000.00 CASH BOND TO COVER BOTH FILES FOR A TOTAL CASH BOND OF $2000.00. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean M Freerksen appeared by video. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Sean M 
Freerksen. 
This covers 20CF363 & 22CF6. 

Warrants quashed. Attorney Rockow represents in 22CF6. Defendant must apply for SPD representation in 20CF363. Address updated/no phone number presently. 

20CF363 - Set before Judge Babler for hearing on 8/31/22 at 10:00 AM. 
22CF6 - Set before Judge Boyle for Preliminary hearing 8/26/22 at 2:30 PM. 

Request by State for additional $1500.00 cash bond to cover both files for a total of $2500.00 cash bond. All conditions remain in full force. Court orders an additional $1000.00 cash bond to cover both files.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Bench Warrant  -  Body only -  Wisconsin and Adjacent states.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Sean M Freerksen in court by Zoom video with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington by Zoom video AND Attorney Dustin Rockow by Zoom video.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
COVERS 20CF363 & 22CF6.
20CF363 - Arraignment -  Case to be recalled.  10:50 a.m. back on the record. Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Attorney Harrington relates on collateral attack.  Motion Hearing set before Judge Babler and may appear by Zoom video.
22CF6 - Judge Boyle file.  Attorney Rockow relates. Attorney Harringotn relates he is appointed to 20CF363.  Time limits waived and preliminary hearing set before Judge Boyle for 02/16/2022 @ 8:30 a.m.  Defendant can appear by Zoom video.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

12:59 PM Defendant Sean M Freerksen in court by Zoom video with attorney Andrew T Knaak by Zoom video for today only.  Defendant Sean M Freerksen in custody.  John A Rafa Todd appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
COVERS 22CF6 (Initial Appearance) and 20CF363 (Warrant).
22CF6 - Address and phone number updated.  Attorney Knaak relates Defendant must call the public defenders office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Attorney Knaak relates Andrew Harrington represents Defendant in 20CF363.  State requests cash bond.  1:07 p.m. Attorney Knaak and Defendant put in a break-out room. 1:11 p.m. Back on the record.  Court sets cash bond TO COVER BOTH FILES.  AIA set before Judge Babler 01/26/22 at 10:00 a.m.

20CF363 - Warrant quashed.  Arraignment set before Judge Babler 01/26/22 at 10:00 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
